title: More than 20 dead, hundreds displaced as cyclone slams southern Brazil
description: A storm has devastated the southern state of Rio Grande Sul, the latest in a string of extreme weather events.

title: Enrique Tarrio, ex-Proud Boys leader, gets 22 years for US Capitol riot
description: Tarrio, convicted of seditious conspiracy, gets longest prison sentence to date in relation to January 6, 2021, attack.

title: Saudi and Iran exchange ambassadors after rapprochement
description: China brokered a rapprochement between Riyadh and Tehran last month leading to resumption of full diplomatic relations.

title: UN ‘concerned’ by harassment of human rights defenders in Bangladesh
description: UN human rights chief Volker Turk calls on Dhaka to create a 'safe' environment for activists and civil society leaders.

title: Georgia attorney general charges 61 ‘Cop City’ protesters with racketeering
description: The protesters had been involved in attempts to stop the construction of a new police training facility in the US.

title: North Korea would pay ‘price’ if it supplies Russia with weapons, US says
description: White House adviser says Russia-North Korea arms negotiations are 'actively advancing', warns Pyongyang against deal.

title: France reportedly in talks with Niger for possible withdrawal of its troops
description: Talks under way for the 'partial withdrawal' of troops amid frayed ties following July 26 coup, according to reports.

title: Papua New Guinea opens Israel embassy in West Jerusalem
description: Pacific nation joins small club of countries with embassy in Jerusalem - the eastern half of which is occupied territory

title: Birmingham, UK’s second biggest city, declares financial distress
description: The English city, home to more than one million people, admits it cannot balance its books.

title: Fit-again Rahul in, Ashwin out as India name Cricket World Cup squad
description: Jasprit Bumrah will return to lead the pace attack after leaving the Asia Cup squad to attend the birth of his child.

title: Do Africans have the means to achieve green development?
description: The first Africa Climate Summit will address how to tackle the continent's climate change challenges.

title: At least 53 Burkina Faso soldiers, volunteers killed in clashes with rebels
description: Killings in Yatenga province came as army tries to retake territory from fighters to allow return of displaced people.

title: Trump’s White House chief of staff pleads not guilty in Georgia case
description: Mark Meadows joins Trump and other co-defendants in waiving formal arraignment hearings in US election subversion case.

title: Why would North Korea’s Kim and Russia’s Putin want to meet?
description: Moscow seeking to quash Kyiv counteroffensive while Pyongyang is extending pace of missile testing.

title: Taiwan’s President Tsai begins visit to Eswatini, last ally in Africa
description: Tsai is visiting Eswatini, formerly known as Swaziland, as African country marks 55 years of independence.

title: ‘Sport has power’: Luol Deng on South Sudan, basketball and inspiring hope
description: The former NBA star talks to Al Jazeera about building South Sudan's basketball team and why sport can change lives.

title: Retiring de Kock named in South Africa’s pace-heavy Cricket World Cup squad
description: Temba Bavuma will lead the Proteas while Quinton de Kock will end his ODI career after the tournament in India.

title: Spain women’s team coach Jorge Vilda fired amid Rubiales kiss fallout
description: Vilda fired less than three weeks after Spain won the Women's World Cup and amid scandal involving the federation chief.

title: Who is Jacob Lew, Biden’s nominee for US ambassador to Israel?
description: Lew, an outspoken supporter of Israel and former secretary of the US Treasury, holds extensive government experience.

title: Ministerial meeting heralds warmer relations between Greece and Turkey
description: Foreign ministers meet in Ankara saying they seek to reach 'common ground' to resolve decades-old disputes.

title: Torrential rains batter Greece after wildfires
description: Storm Daniel floods homes and roads in central Greece prompting authorities to order vehicles off the streets.

title: South Africa announces inquiry into Johannesburg fire that killed 76 people
description: At least 76 people died in the fire at a building abandoned by authorities and hijacked by illegal 'landlords'.

title: Geronimo and the war on Indigenous people
description: The Apache leader and medicine man was one of the last Native American resistance fighters to surrender.

title: In leaked phone calls, Russian soldiers appear angry at losses in Ukraine
description: Excerpts released by Kyiv of phone calls placed in early July appear to show Russian troops complaining.

title: Trial of man charged with running down Muslim family in Canada to begin
description: Authorities say Nathaniel Veltman deliberately targeted Muslims in deadly, hate-fuelled attack in Ontario in 2021.

title: India’s Modi gov’t replaces country’s name with Bharat in G20 dinner invite
description: Uproar after government replaces India with a Sanskrit word in dinner invites sent to guests at this week's summit.

title: Jordan Henderson defends move to Saudi Arabia after LGBTQ rights criticism
description: The England star, who has spoken out in support of LGBTQ rights, apologises for hurt caused by his move to Al Ettifaq.

title: Q&A: East Timor’s ASEAN membership and the Myanmar conflict
description: President Jose Ramos-Horta insists East Timor is on track to join ASEAN, which seeks to resolve the crisis in Myanmar.

title: Myanmar will not be allowed ASEAN leadership in 2026
description: The move is a new blow to the ruling generals seeking international recognition after seizing power in 2021.

title: What we are witnessing in Africa is not an anti-colonial revolution
description: Coups benefiting just a few military elites are not, and can never be, meaningful acts of anti-imperialist resistance.

title: Al Ittihad offer Liverpool world record fee for Mohamed Salah: The Sun
description: The Sun reports that officials from the Saudi club are in the UK to make a $270m offer for the Egyptian superstar.

title: Two officers arrested in DR Congo for crackdown that killed 43 people
description: Security forces used lethal force last week to repress planned anti-UN protests in the city of Goma.

title: Greece: 700 firefighters battle to bring massive fire under control
description: Wildfires are common in Greece and other Southern European countries during their hot, dry summers.

title: Trump is back and the liberal American media are loving it
description: Detailed media coverage of Trump's legal troubles by US cable networks has seen TV ratings shoot up.

title: Egypt, reliant on imports, buys more Russian wheat
description: Egypt still buys from Russia and Ukraine but is also diversifying its purchases after the shock of the war.

title: Amid anticorruption purge, Ukraine set to appoint Muslim defence chief
description: Rustem Umerov is from the Muslim Tatar community in Crimea that largely resisted Russia's 2014 annexation.

title: Israel kills Palestinian, destroys even more of Nur Shams camp
description: Israeli forces kill Ayed Abu Harb, 21, in a large-scale raid on the Nur Shams camp in Tulkarem.

title: G20 in India: When will 2023 New Delhi summit be held and who is attending?
description: The two-day summit will see leaders of the world's richest and most powerful countries meet over a range of issues.

title: Billions pledged for green energy as Africa climate talks enter second day
description: The three-day Nairobi summit, which began on Monday, is meant to define a shared vision for green development in Africa.

title: Schools in France send dozens of Muslim girls home for wearing abayas
description: Schoolgirls, who refuse to change out of the loose-fitting robe, are sent home with a letter to parents on secularism.

title: Fourteen people and a body found on Greek island after boat tragedy
description: Greek authorities say the refugees and migrants who survived boarded a dinghy in Turkey that ultimately sank.

title: Jordan shoots down drug-laden drone from Syria in ninth incident this year
description: The military says a drone carrying crystal meth is intercepted after crossing the country’s border with Syria.

title: Nigerian unions strike again to protest soaring costs after subsidy removal
description: Government workers in Nigeria are striking over the rising costs of living worsened by the removal of petrol subsidies.

title: Calls to tax the superrich grow as economic inequality surges
description: Billionaires have seen their wealth expand by 109 percent over the past decade as their fortunes increase $2.7bn a day.

title: Press freedom concerns as India editors’ body charged over Manipur report
description: Manipur police file cases against Editors Guild of India members, accusing them of promoting enmity between groups.

title: Burning Man mass exodus begins after flooding trapped desert revelers
description: About 30,000 people remain at the site with some waiting to see the burning of a large wooden effigy shaped like a man.

title: Brazil’s Antony dropped from national squad over domestic violence claims
description: Brazilian football federation has replaced the Manchester United player with Arsenal's Gabriel Jesus.

title: Photos: Road reopens at drenched Burning Man party in US desert
description: Thousands of festivalgoers were stranded in deep mud in Nevada after rain turned the gathering into a quagmire.

title: Eritrean troops ‘committed war crimes’ in Ethiopia, says Amnesty report
description: Amnesty report details how Eritrean soldiers extrajudicially executed civilians and sexually enslaved women for months.

title: China touts ‘Belt and Road’ to Italy amid growing doubts in Rome
description: China's Wang Yi hails 'thousand-year friendship' with Italy as Rome weighs exit from infrastructure drive.

title: In Sudan’s South Darfur, armed men pillage, loot under cover of fighting
description: As the armed foes go toe-to-toe in South Darfur, residents strive to find secure shelters amid intense fighting.

title: What did Putin and Erdogan discuss in Sochi?
description: Turkey's Recep Tayyip Erdogan holds talks with Russia’s Vladimir Putin amid international efforts to revive grain deal.

title: Israel halts exports from Gaza at key crossing, says explosives found
description: Israeli forces tell Palestinian border officials that Gaza crossing will remain closed 'until further notice'.

title: Japan tells WTO China’s seafood ban over Fukushima water ‘unacceptable’
description: Japanese officials have signalled Tokyo may file a formal WTO complaint over China's trade restrictions.

title: Russia says it downed 3 Ukrainian ‘attack drones’ in latest raid on Moscow
description: Drones shot down over Kaluga and Tver regions, bordering the Moscow region, and one in Istra district of Moscow region.

title: From toads to bugs, UN says invasive species rising at ‘unprecedented rate’
description: Landmark report says invasive species are major threat to biodiversity and dealing with them requires global cooperation

title: Cuba uncovers network trafficking Cubans to fight for Russia in Ukraine
description: Cuba says it has no part in war in Ukraine and would 'act vigorously' against those trafficking Cubans as fighters.

title: Solomon Islands MPs demand answers over ‘replica’ guns from China
description: Opposition leader Matthew Wale accuses police commissioner of misleading citizens after Al Jazeera report.

title: CEO of Australia’s embattled Qantas steps down early
description: Alan Joyce says he is leaving airline 'knowing the company is fundamentally strong and has a bright future'.

title: Putin says again Ukraine counteroffensive ‘has failed’ as Kyiv claims gains
description: Russian president and defence officials in Kyiv give conflicting accounts of situation on front lines in Ukraine.

title: Vanuatu elects Kilman as prime minister amid crisis over Australia pact
description: Move comes after a court upheld a vote of no-confidence in Ishmael Kalsaku who had sought closer ties with Australia.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 559
description: As the war enters its 559th day, these are the main developments.

title: Chevron workers at LNG plants in Australia to strike as dispute escalates
description: Industrial action at Gorgon and Wheatstone projects in Western Australia has raised fears for global gas supplies.

title: Russian General Surovikin seen in first photo since Wagner revolt: Reports
description: General Surovikin reported removed after Wagner mutiny said to be 'alive, healthy, at home, with his family, in Moscow'.

title: Malaysia calls for ‘strong’ measures on Myanmar as ASEAN meets
description: The 10-member Southeast Asian grouping has been strained to the limit over the crisis caused by the 2021 military coup.
